title: Jewish Reporter Who Was Told By Trump To Sit Down Defends Him
text:
Jewish Reporter Who Was Told By Trump To Sit Down Defends Him "I’m with him when it comes to being outraged ..." by Randy DeSoto February 17, 2017 at 5:17pm Share on Facebook Share Tweet Email Email Print   
Numerous media outlets raised the specter of President Donald Trump being anti-Semitic based on an interchange he had with a Jewish reporter at a press conference on Thursday, even though the reporter in question did not see it that way. 
“Why are people that aren’t Jewish describing what is anti-Semitism?” the reporter, Jake Trux with Ami Magazine, wondered during an interview on Fox News later that evening. 
Turx, who is an orthodox Jew, began his question to Trump by saying he had not seen anybody in his community accuse him or his staff of being anti-Semitic. He noted that Trump’s a grandfather to Jewish children through is son-in-law, Jared Kushner.   Comedian Tweets Donald Trump Jr., Asks Him To Expel Father From White House 
The reporter then went on to ask what sounded like it was going to be a very similar question to one the president had received the day before about the potential rise in anti-semitism, since he has taken office. 
Turx stated , “There’s been a report out that 48 bomb threats have been made against Jewish centers across the country in the last couple of weeks. There are people committing anti-Semitic acts or threatening to….” 
Trump interjected, “OK, sit down, I understand the rest of your question.”   
He later told Turx to be quiet, when the reporter perceived he misunderstood the question. 
Turn told Fox News host Ed Henry he realized he had hit a sore spot with Trump.   Ivanka Trump Posts Picture From Oval Office That’s Creating Buzz 
“It is very unfair what’s been done to him,” Turx stated. “So I understand why he’s so defensive. I’m with him when it comes to being outraged about him being charged with this anti-Semitism.” 
“I’m the least anti-Semitic person you have ever seen in your entire life,” Trump said in response to what he perceived to be Turx’s question. “Let me tell you something, I hate the charge. I find it repulsive.” 
Turx tweeted after the news conference: President Trump clearly misunderstood my question. This is highly regretful and I'm going to seek clarification. #TrumpNewsConference 
— Jake Turx (@JakeTurx) February 16, 2017 
When the issue of anti-Semitism came up at during a joint press conference with Benjamin Netanyahu on Wednesday, the Israeli prime minister came strongly to Trump’s defense. 
“I’ve known President Trump for many years … and there is no greater supporter of the Jewish people and the Jewish state than President Donald Trump. I think we should put that to rest,” Netanyahu said. At a joint press conference at the White House, Israeli PM @netanyahu had strong words of support for @POTUS . https://t.co/OhpHFuAHEd pic.twitter.com/1TUHcRzsGq 
— Fox News (@FoxNews) February 15, 2017 
Turx noted during his Fox interview that Trump has “h as done an unprecedented amount of outreach with the orthodox Jewish community, a nd we understand why [the charges of anti-Semitism are] so hurtful [for] him to see.” What do you think?
